thread.title: No such thing as ‘Bangsa Johor’ identity cards, says state govt
thread.title_full: No such thing as ‘Bangsa Johor’ identity cards, says state govt

author: YEE XIANG YUN
title: No such thing as ‘Bangsa Johor’ identity cards, says state govt
text:
| MYT 10:11 AM No such thing as ‘Bangsa Johor’ identity cards, says state govt by yee xiang yun 
JOHOR BARU: The Johor Government has denied issuing “Bangsa Johor" identity cards after photos of the purported new card circulated on social media. 
State Secretary Azmi Rohani said that neither the Johor Government nor any of its related agencies or departments had introduced such identity cards. 
“The usage of the Johor identity for such purposes without referring to the State Secretary is strictly prohibited. 
“The state government and its agencies have never produced such identity cards,” he said in a statement Thursday. 
It is learnt that a police report was lodged at the Seri Alam district police headquarters on Thursday evening. 
Several social media posts, which have since gone viral, show a card bearing the words “identiti Bangsa Johor,” urging the public to sign up for the identity card. 
The card featured a Malaysian identity card number, with a second line of numbers underneath it showing the “Bangsa Johor” identity number. 
In addition, the card also claimed to double-up as a debit card to make purchases. 
The back of the card shows the address of the cardholder and the name of next-of-kin, including a statement that the card was for verification of Bangsa Johor.
